content:  at the end of the row your rectangle will look curved not straight don t worry this is normal row 4 7 single_crochet *1 slip_stitch in the bob 3 single_crochet* x12 times 63 single_crochet chain 1 turn 106 single_crochet 12 slip_stitch  your rectangle should look straight now more or less row 5 68 single_crochet *1 bob 3 single_crochet* x11 times 6 single_crochet chain 1 turn 107 single_crochet 11 bob row 6 9 single_crochet *1 slip_stitch in the bob 3 single_crochet* x11 times 65 single_crochet chain 1 turn 107 single_crochet 11 slip_stitch row 7 repeat row 3 106 single_crochet 12 bob row 8 repeat row 4 106 single_crochet 12 slip_stitch row 9 single_crochet in every stitch cut yarn and secure 118 single_crochet assembly fold your rectangle so that you have your bobbles plus 2 single_crochet on one side 56 stitches long and a plain single_crochet rectangle on the other 62 stitches long pin in place with new yarn starting from the base crochet 56 single_crochet through both thicknesses to join the piece picture below shows where to start joining number 1 and 2 each indicate a single_crochet 6 single_crochet in the remaining stitches on the side short side 3 single_crochet chain 5 to make the buttonhole and 3 single_crochet again if your button is bigger chain accordingly back on the long side 6 single_crochet then 56 single_crochet through both thicknesses to join cut the yarn and secure sew the button in place
